Posts.Content: Jan 28, 2014 09:02PM luvmywalker wrote: I just had the same thing happen in December.  They thought the lump was a cyst, but after the cyst was drained I still had the lump immediately after. I really had a feeling when they were saying cyst and draining it that they were in the wrong spot.  I even made a comment to the US tech that what I was feeling didn't look like what was on the screen.  Went back to the BS this month and she felt it, a resident dr. felt it - didn't show on ultrasound.  She did an excisional biopsy on Friday and took it out.  She says it's not cancer.  I see her again on Monday and will get my pathology report then to find out exactly what it was, but her eyes say it's benign!
Posts.Title: Lump still the same after cyst aspiration? scared-mammy AZ85048

Posts.Content: Jan 29, 2014 09:12AM luvmywalker wrote: Thinking I'm going to call tomorrow to see if the pathology report is in, but I trust my surgeon very much and if she says no cancer, I'm pretty confident that she is right.  I know how frustrated you are with not knowing what that lump is and knowing it is still there.  Don't let them make you feel like you are crazy! I think they see that cyst pop up on US and just assume that's what the problem is - easy fix.   Keep persistent and get the answers that you need.  I found it encouraging that the lump was not showing on US or mammo - making more likely the chances that it is just normal tissue, but I needed to know for sure, because there are nasty things that can "hide".  Excisional biopsy has helped with my anxiety and was well worth it!  In my experience it has been pretty easy.  Hardest part for me is remembering not to do any lifting for a while!
Posts.Title: Lump still the same after cyst aspiration? scared-mammy AZ85048
